taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe cichorieae;genus malacothrix;species saxatilis;variety arachnoidea

bio:treatment.description: Plants rhizomatous or with woody caudices. Herbage tomentose. Stems 1 (from rhizomes) or 2–3+ (from caudices), erect, freely branched, herbaceous or proximally woody, relatively leafy distally. Cauline leaves: proximal not pinnately lobed (lanceolate to elliptic, margins usually entire, apices acute); distal broadly lance-linear to elliptic or linear (firm, bases gradually tapering), margins usually entire, sometimes denticulate, apices usually acute. Arrays of heads relatively crowded to open. Cypselae 2.2–2.5 mm. 2n = 18.
Rocky open banks, chaparral, coastal sage;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety arachnoidea grows in Carmel Valley (Monterey County) and in the San Rafael Mountains (Santa Barbara County).
